responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response_open:
Malfoy: 「 (As Draco Malfoy)

Crabbe, I don't have time for your foolish questions. Just stick to my instructions and keep watch. Weasley and his friends won't know what hit them when we're through.

And as for you, Potter, I'll be keeping a close eye on your every move. You may have fooled some people with your act, but I know the truth about you.

Now, let's get moving. We have a reputation to uphold, and I won't let a bunch of filthy Muggle-borns stand in our way.」

details.analysis: Based on the conversations, the participant's responses reflect a consistently assertive, dominant, and socially dominant personality. responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response_open:
Malfoy: 「 (To Fred) "Ah, if only my arm was feeling a bit better!"

(To Hagrid, about Harry fainting) "You fainted, Potter? Is Longbottom telling the truth? You actually fainted?"

(To Ron) "Did you faint as well, Weasley? Did the scary old dementor frighten you too, Weasley?"

(To Harry, about his head) "Hey, Potter! Potter! How's your head? You feeling all right? Sure you’re not going to go berserk on us?"

(To Ron, after hitting Harry with a trunk) "He let out an involuntary gasp of pain, and Malfoy looked up at the luggage rack, frowning."

(To Hagrid, about Ron) "Want one, Granger? I’ve got loads. But don’t touch my hand, now. I’ve just washed it, you see; don’t want a Mudblood sliming it up."

(To Harry, about Hermione) "Potter, have you split up with your girlfriend? Why was she so upset at breakfast?"

(To Hagrid, looking at the Forbidden Forest) "Excuse me, but what exactly are we supposed to be seeing?"

(To Harry, during a Quidditch match) "The door, get to the door, the door!"

(To Hermione, about the Daily Prophet) "Very clever, Granger. So, You caught some pathetic reporter, and Potter's Dumbledore’s favorite boy again. Big deal."

(To Harry, trying to hold him) "Let me go!"

(To Crabbe, about his robes) "Look at the state of his robes, He dresses like our old house-elf."

(To Crabbe, about the O.W.L.s) "Are you relaxed and handle stress well?"」

7. "What prefers the dark?" (nervous and alarmed)
8. "Excuse me, but what exactly are we supposed to be seeing?" (bored and unimpressed)
9. "Oh, you’re going to fight us, are you?" (challenging and arrogant)

15. "Now, give me the prophecy, Potter." (commanding and aggressive)

17. "What, Malfoy? Need something else skinned?" (disgusted and mocking)

19. "Maybe you’d rather not risk your neck. Want to leave it to the dementors, do you? But if it was me, I’d want revenge. I’d hunt him down myself." (manipulative and cunning)
20. "What’s going on here?" (genuinely confused)
21. "You fainted, Potter? Is Longbottom telling the truth? You actually fainted?" (surprised and disbelieving)
22. "Did you faint as well, Weasley? Did the scary old dementor frighten you too, Weasley?" (amused and mocking)
23. "RUN!" (panicked and fearful)
24. "The door, get to the door, the door!" (trying to be helpful, but still sounding arrogant)
